article.headline: Lehigh 77, American U. 65
article.story: WASHINGTON -- Zahir Carrington scored 20 points to lead Lehigh in a 77-65 win over American on Saturday. The Mountain Hawks (15-8, 6-2 Patriot League), who have won five of their last six, saw four players score in double figures. CJ McCollum finished with 19 points and a career-high 13 rebounds, Marquis Hall scored 18 points and Gabe Knutson had 10. After a 3-pointer from American's Joe Hill cut Lehigh's lead to 65-60, the Mountain Hawks responded with an 8-0 run to take a 73-60 advantage with 1:13 remaining. Vlad Moldoveanu paced the Eagles (7-16, 4-4) with 24 points. American had a three-game winning streak snapped. Lehigh outrebounded American 35-30, and scored 15 points off of the Eagles' 14 turnovers. More than half of American's field goal attempts were 3-pointers, but they shot only 26.5 percent from beyond the arc (9-for-34). Lehigh shot 50 percent from 3-point range (6-for-12).

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
